byline.original: By MICHAEL BARBARO and YAMICHE ALCINDOR

abstract: News Analysis; Sen Bernie Sanders's concession speech in California was notable for fact he failed to mention historic victory of Hillary Clinton, who became first woman to win nomination of major United States political party; many in Democratic Party expected Sanders to offer her kind of salute, one that never came, even as he vowed to continue to fight on.
lead_paragraph: Despite the insurmountable delegate math, Mr. Sanders took the stage in Southern California and vowed to fight on.

headline.main: Hillary Clinton Made History, but Bernie Sanders Stubbornly Ignored It
headline.print_headline: A History-Making Moment for Clinton, but Sanders Ignores It

snippet: Despite the insurmountable delegate math, Mr. Sanders took the stage in Southern California and vowed to fight on.
